title: Updating VAT percentage in product information
description: Updating the VAT percentage should be possible without creating a new product. The tax rate history should be available based on change occurrences and visible on the UI.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Proposal to update VAT rate for product info change.
argumentation_for_proposal: Supports product data flexibility for new VAT requirements.

title: Notification of accounting point ID change
description: Changing DH-311-4, DH-331-3, DH-351-3 notifications to send related accounting point ID instead of the main accounting point ID.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Proposal to clarify accounting point ID logic.
argumentation_for_proposal: Improves clarity in accounting point communication.

title: Contract retrospective cancellation notification
description: Validating that grid and sales agreements correspond for the same customer when confirming the grid contract.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Proposal for customer validation to align grid and sales agreements.
argumentation_for_proposal: Improves system consistency and reduces errors.

title: Customer information validation on grid contract
description: Validation to ensure that grid agreement corresponds to the sales contract customer.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Update the DH-312-1 request to include customer info for validation.
argumentation_for_proposal: Validates contract accuracy and reduces data inconsistencies.

title: PO Box and Street Address validation
description: Validation rule to ensure only one address type (PO Box or street) is given, and building number requires a street name.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Ensure only one address type is included and building numbers have street names.
argumentation_for_proposal: Addresses data quality issues.

title: Agreement end date notification
description: Allow a supplier or DSO to notify contract end dates when a new contract starts on the same day.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Ensure contract end notifications match contract terms for new agreements.
argumentation_for_proposal: Supports contract management and reduces notification errors.

title: Fixed Term Agreement validation update
description: Modify validation rules to check fixed term dates only when updated.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Only apply fixed term date validation when changes are made to the dates.
argumentation_for_proposal: Improves flexibility in contract management.

title: Disconnection notification chain
description: Implement message IDs to track connection and disconnection requests for better process management.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Implement a new field to track the source of disconnections (supplier or DSO).
argumentation_for_proposal: Improves tracking and process reliability.

title: Notification of Unconfirmed SAG End
description: Cancellation Notification for Unconfirmed Sales Agreement
development_proposal_and_clarification:
DSO to receive info of SAG (sales agreement) end or cancellation:
In case DDQ ends or cancels a SAG before DSO has confirmed their GAG (grid agreement), DSO doesn't receive information about the SAG end or cancellation. It would be good to notify the DSO also when GAG is not yet confirmed.

Origin: Market Party wish list -selected in January 2022
argumentation_for_proposal: Verkko saisi tiedon jos myyjä heti peruu tai päättää sopimuksen.

title: Customer Data Character Verification
description: Validation to Prevent Invalid Characters in Customer Data
development_proposal_and_clarification:
Customer data characters to be verified:
With Customer data update there should be verified that there aren't useless characters with customer's name to be updated to Datahub. 
Eg. "JÃ¤msÃ¤nkosken MetsÃ¤stysyhdistys ry. " characters shouldn't be allowed

Origin: Market Party wish list -selected in January 2022
argumentation_for_proposal: Asiakastiedon laatu saadaan pidettyä parempana.
next_steps: Kehitystyöryhmässä todettiin, että on vaikea löytää merkistöä, joka sallisi tarvittavasti merkkejä ja estäisi vain todella turhat. Sovittiin, että selvitetään vielä väärien tietojen määriä ja sitä, onko kyse mahdollisesti ollut käyttöönoton ongelmasta vai tuleeko näitä edelleen ja kuinka monelta osapuolelta.

title: Invoice Email Validation
description: Restrict Email Updates Only When Invoicing Channel is Email
development_proposal_and_clarification:
Email  invoice to be updateable only if the correct Invoice channel chosen:
Market party  has received updates to agreements with invoicing email address, although agreement invoice channel is not  email address.
argumentation_for_proposal: Tietojen laadun ylläpito.

title: Data Privacy in Logging of Identifiers
description: Use POST Method to Prevent Logging Sensitive Data
development_proposal_and_clarification:
Data interface is using person id or company id for requests. Those URL requests are logged into log file and that shall not happen.

Example:
https://dh-fingrid-sat01-b2b.azurewebsites.net/rest/FGR/DIFGetCustomerData?organisationUser=B2BCGdso1AAdmin&TenantCode=FGR&customerIdentification=DDMMYY-1234

See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39568719/rest-api-get-with-sensitive-data

This is a data privacy issues.
argumentation_for_proposal: Parantaa tietoturvaa.
proposal_impact: Järjestelmätoimittajat joutuvat toteuttamaan tuen uudelle rajapintakutsumetodille. Voidaan tarvittaessa rakentaa väliaikainen tuki molemmille metodeille ja esim. 6 kk jälkeen vanha metodi otetaan pois käytöstä.

title: Supplier Notification on Accounting Point Changes
description: Notify Future Supplier of Retrospective Switch On
development_proposal_and_clarification: Accounting point has been without supplier and switched off. Supplier notifies new sales contract into datahub. The supplier has found out the status of the accounting point (switched off). Later DSO informs retrospective switch on, the switch on date is previous day of the contract start date -> supplier does not get information about switch on, because the information is disclosed only to the current supplier of the accounting point.
argumentation_for_proposal: Helpottaisi myyjää kyllä jos saisi tiedon. Voiko muuttaa käsittelyä niin, että jos tuo käyttöpaikan päivitys ilmoitetaan sopimuksen voimaantulon jälkeen (vaikka itse muutospäivä olisi aikaisemmalle päivälle) niin myyjä saisi tiedot.
next_steps: Asia viedään alityöryhmän käsittelyyn. GDPR asia tuskin on muutettavissa, mutta tätä tarkastetaan myös, mikäli oikeuspuolen kevennyksellä asia olisi ratkottavissa yksinkertaisemmin.

title: Phone Number Format Validation
description: Implement ITU-T.164 Format Check for Phone Numbers
development_proposal_and_clarification: Phone number format shall get a validation rule. Datahub has defined phone number in format ITU-T.164 (+358501234567) but datahub does not validate this.
argumentation_for_proposal: Tiedon laadun ylläpito paranee
next_steps: Kehitysehdotusta kannatetaan ja se viedään eteenpäin huomioiden prosessit DH-321/322, joissa ei tarkasteta kolmatta kohtaa (Maatunnusta '+358' seuraava numero ei saa olla nolla).

title: Complex AR04 Cancellation Rules
description: Clarification requested for AR04 cancellation rule complexities.
development_proposal_and_clarification:
As a DSO we see the cancellation code AR04  very complex. AR04 code can be used even supplier has made contract as delivery contract. That cannot happen in real that end customer cancels only selling if there is delivery contract. Datahub should conclude that delivery contract cannot be cancelled with AR04 code or if it can be cancelled, then grid contract shall be cancelled as well. It is not possible that end customer can get from other supplier delivery contract if delivery responsible supplier has already cancelled the contract.

Could this cancellation reason and its rules be re-evaluated in development workgroup. This requires new definitions to the datahub rules.
argumentation_for_proposal: Aiheuttaa paljon manuaalikäsittelyä verkon suunnalla ja jos verkkosopimusta ei erikseen peruta voi tieto toimitussopimuksesta jäädä väärin ja aiheuttaa ongelmia mm. asiakkaan laskutuksessa.

title: DH-341-3 Agreement Identification
description: Add identifier to DH-341-3 notification for agreement tracking
development_proposal_and_clarification:
Agreement identification should be added to the DH-341-3 notification.

We had a case where a metering point had a valid sales agreement and also a sales agreement starting in the future. Another supplier reported a move-in ending the valid agreement and cancelling the future agreement.

Move-in made by the other supplier was cancelled and datahub sent two DH-341-3 notifications (fully identical except for the message id). How should the notifications be connected to the restored agreements when they include only a metering point id and the date of the cancelled moved-in?
argumentation_for_proposal: Myyjä ei pysty kohdistamaan kumpaa sopimusta ilmoitus koskee mikäli on ollut kaksi sopimusta jotka palautetaan voimaan uuden sopimuksen peruutuksessa.

title: Handling "Under Construction" to "Switched" State Change
description: Refine handling of agreement start date for metering points in "Under Construction" state
development_proposal_and_clarification: Metering point state change from "Under costruction" to the "Switched" rules shall be re-evaluated. The current rules say that if metering point "Under costruction" has valid contract when it is switch on, datahub will automatically contract valid start from date according to the switching date. This servers handling of new metering points. But same functionality/rules are valid also when metering point has been changed due to renovation to the "Under costruction" state, without updates on contract state. In that case if DSO changes the stae directly to switched on, changes the contract valid from date with same rules, even should not in this case.
argumentation_for_proposal: Toteutettu malli aiheuttaa tällä hetkellä paljon harmia osapuolille. Kytkentätilan muutos aiheuttaa sopimusten voimaantuloaikojen päivityksen myös silloin, kun kohde on saneerauksessa ja muutettu tilaan rakenteilla. On ohjeistettu että tällöin käyttöpaikka tulee ensin muuttaa tilaan katkaistu, ennen kytkentää. Näin vältytään sopimusten päivitykseltä.
proposal_impact: Myyjälle ja jakeluverkonhaltijalle lähetetään ilmoitus oman sopimuksen muuttuneesta päivämäärästä. Tätä varten lisätään uusi sanomatyyppi.

title: Validation Rule for DH-124-1 Event
description: New validation rule to restrict BE14 user group usage
development_proposal_and_clarification: New validatio rule for the event DH-124-1 so that supplier cannot requested as user group BE14 in case there has been defined specific user group for the metering point. At the moment DSO systems updates user group automatically and thus the specific user group information is updated and lost.
argumentation_for_proposal: Tiedon laadun ylläpito paranee. Tällä hetkellä käyttäjäryhmä menee automatiikalla käyttöpaikalle verkon järjestelmissä ja jo tarkemmaksi määritelty tieto häviää ja rapautuu tämän myötä.
proposal_impact: Myyjä ei pysty päivittämään käyttäjäryhmää mikäli se on jo jakeluverkkoyhtiön toimesta määritelty.
next_steps:
Selvitetään tilannetta tiketin nostajan kanssa tarkemmin. Jatkotoimet näiden pohjalta.
26.3.2024: Selvitetään BE14-käyttäjäryhmää lähettävät osapuolet ja haetaan asiaan ratkaisua osapuolten kontaktoinnilla ja ohjeistuksella.

title: Personal ID Validation Update
description: Modify personal identification validation rules to accept new divider signs
development_proposal_and_clarification:
The most urgent need in changing the personal identification system is related to ensuring that there are enough personal identification numbers in the future. 
From the beginning of 2023, new divider signs/letters will be introduced into the personal identity number for those born in the 20th and 21st centuries:
- For those born in the 21st century, letters starting from B, in addition to the current letter A (A, B, C, D, E, F, H, J, K, L, M).
- For those born in the 20th century, letters starting from Y, in addition to the current sign - (-, Y, X, W, V, U, T, S, R, P, N).

Datahub must accept the new divider signs/letters in the personal identification number.

In addition, there can be 'estate of deceased person' customers that have personal IDs for people born in the 19th century (sign '+' in the personal ID, e.g. DDMMYY+1234), and therefore '+' must also be accepted as a divider sign in the personal identification.
argumentation_for_proposal: The new dividers can be issued both to newborn children but also the immigrants getting a finnish personal identification, which is why the change needs to be in affect from the beginning of year 2023.

title: Grid Ending Event Handling
description: Grid cannot handle ending event correctly if there's a new move-in, as it reverts agreements incorrectly to valid status. In cases where a new move-in is canceled, the previous grid agreement may restore mistakenly.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Grid must handle separate ending events correctly without reverting agreements mistakenly due to a new move-in notification.
argumentation_for_proposal: Causes significant manual workload for operators to correct erroneous reverts.

title: DH-311-4 Notification Duplication Issue
description: DH-311-4 sent to the same supplier multiple times if the accounting point has linked agreements with the same supplier. Request for rule alignment with DH-311-3.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Add same rule to DH-311-4 as DH-311-3, avoiding unnecessary notifications to the same supplier.
argumentation_for_proposal: Potential to reduce unnecessary communications, depending on recipient system.
proposal_impact: Continue discussion in upcoming session; determine if change is needed for all scenarios.

title: Automation of Supplier Ending Process
description: Manual process for supplier termination risks error and is labor-intensive; automation requested for reliability.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Proposal for automated system support for tracking and terminating supplier agreements with minimal manual steps.
argumentation_for_proposal: Reduces errors and workload; simplifies coordination across DSOs.
proposal_impact: Complete as part of holistic review of supplier termination process, cost assessment needed.

title: Agreement Refusal Error Handling
description: Difficulty in refusing agreement restoration after an initial end date, causing inconsistencies in agreement end times.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Allow refusal of agreement restoration to be applied retroactively to the original termination date.
argumentation_for_proposal: Rejected due to risk of grid consumption issues without a new sales agreement.

title: Market Operator Cancellation Improvement
description: Operator-initiated cancellations require email notifications, causing delays and manual work for operators.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Initial proposal suggested automatic emails; reconsidered due to risk of incorrect messaging.
argumentation_for_proposal: Daily manual work is significant; improved solution would reduce errors and communication delays.
proposal_impact: Subcommittee prep ongoing; topic may be revisited in future if deemed necessary.

title: Netting Calculation Notification to DSO
description: Request to send netting calculation data to DSO to streamline metering and billing processes.
development_proposal_and_clarification: Currently, netting info is only on the GUI; request for direct DSO notification.
argumentation_for_proposal: Supports more efficient DSO operations by providing data timely for billing.
proposal_impact: Continue with feasibility review and impact assessment.
